newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian unemployment rising - corrected trend.
newsitem.headline: Australian unemployment rising - corrected trend.

text.p: Trend estimates corrected for the distortions of telephone interviewing show that Australian unemployment is rising markedly.

The rate has risen from an 8.5 percent trough in late 1996 to 8.7 percent in March, according to a Reuters recalculation of the data prepared with the assistance of the Australian Bureau of Statistics.
The corrected data shows employment falling at a trend rate of about 5,000 a month and a rock steady participation rate of 63.7 percent.

The bureau says the phase-in of telephone interviewing last year initially understated employment levels for a few months, greatly distorting rates of change in jobs growth, unemployment and participation between August and February.

Instead, it encourages analysts to correct the major labour force figures themselves.
